bite: Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order

On 4 February 2021, a group of anarchists, who had participated earlier in the day in the demonstration against the government's proposed bill on tertiary education reforms, clashed with police near the university campus in central Thessaloniki. The rioters hurled stones and petrol bombs at riot police, who responded with tear gas. There were damages to parked cars. There were 2 detentions and 1 arrest. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Greece (2019-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order

On 4 February 2021, 3,500-5,000 students, teachers and parents demonstrated in Athens - Central Athens against the government's proposed bill on tertiary education reforms. Teachers also demanded the reopening of schools and universities with increased coronavirus protection measures. About 20 youths targeted ODOS, the newly established unarmed police force, hurling rocks, fire extinguishers and petrol bombs at them outside parliament. Riot police responded with tear gas and stun grenades. Another group hurled red paint at the Bank of Greece building. [size=3,500-5,000]

On 4 February 2021, students of Guru Nanak Dev University clashed with the police, in Amritsar (Punjab), during a demonstration demanding online examinations amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. 5 injured. [size=no report]

Property destruction: On 3 February 2021, suspected Fulani pastoralists burnt down a block of classrooms at the Government Secondary School Iluke in Kabba/Bunu LGA (Kogi). One suspect arrested. No reported loss of life or injury.
VDP: Volunteer for Defense of Homeland
On 3 February 2021, presumed ISGS militants attacked the village of Raogo (Pensa, Sanmatenga). Four people were killed, and a school and motorbikes belonging to volunteer fighters (VDP) burned.

On 3 February 2021, students demonstrated at the University of Saint Louis town (Rao, Saint Louis) against the closure of their university restaurant. They barricaded roads and clashed with the security forces (assumed Police Forces). [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, unidentified armed assailants triggered two bomb blasts at the premises of Muliwala Lower Primary School near Assam-Mizoram border (coded as Hailakandi, Hailakandi district, Assam). The school building, drinking water reservoir and a toilet were damaged.

On 3 February 2021, a group of students from the Students Family of Maritim Raja Ali Haji University (KM UMRAH) held a demonstration in front of their university's rectorate building in the Dompak sub-district, Bukit Bestari district, Tanjung Pinang City (Riau Islands province). They demanded tuition discounts during the coronavirus pandemic. They burned tires during the demonstration. [size=no report]
Pajhwok Afghan News; Afghan Islamic Press News Agency
On 3 February 2021, 1 school principal was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in PD6 of Jalalabad city, Nangarhar.

On 3 February 2021, unspecified opposition representatives and activists organized a demonstration in Chkhorotsku, and attempted to enter the city hall building. A brawl started after the police stopped them. The demonstrators were angered by the alleged forcing of schoolchildren to clean the city hall toilets. [size=no report]
Sozcu; Bianet; Anadolu Agency; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Beyaz Gazete

On 2 February 2021, around 100 demonstrators including students gathered in Kizilay quarter of Cankaya, Ankara in solidarity with the demonstrations of Bogazici University students in Istanbul against the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a government decree. Police intervened as the group attempted to march to the Cankaya municipality. Scuffles and struggles were reported between the police forces and some demonstrators that attacked police officers and also threw stones at them. Total 5 police officers and one demonstrator were injured. 83 demonstrators were detained. [size=around 100]
Students (Turkey); TIP: Workers' Party of Turkey; HDP: Peoples Democratic Party; Government of Turkey (2016-); DISK: Confederation of Progressive Trade Unions of Turkey; Labour Group (Turkey)
A Haber; Karar; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Anadolu Agency; Beyaz Gazete

On 2 February 2021, around 500 demonstrators gathered in Kadikoy town center, Istanbul in solidarity with the demonstrations of Bogazici University students in Istanbul against the appointment of a new president from outside the university via a government decree. Scuffles were reported between the riot police that intervened in the event with rubber bullets and tear gas and the demonstrators that attacked police vehicles by throwing stones. Student groups, DISK executives, TIP and HDP MPs attended the demonstration. 6 demonstrators were lightly injured due to rubber bullets and 94 others were detained by the police. [size=around 500]

On 2 February 2021, an unknown militant attempted to attack a school in Kirkuk city, but was wounded by a guard. Iraqi security forces responded by giving the militant chase and killing him on the Azadi intersection. 1 Fatality and no injuries.
JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims and/or Islamic State (Greater Sahara)
Looting: On 2 February 2021, presumed JNIM or ISGS seized supplies at a school in the village of Niagassi (Sampelga, Seno).

On 2 February 2021, a group of supporters of a high school principal threw stones at the house of one of the employees of the Western Cape Education Department involved in the disciplinary process concerning the principal in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western cape). The principal is facing charges related to his refusal to reopen the school amid the coronavirus infection peak in 2020. A man was injured. [size=no report]
Police Forces of Iraq (2020-) Iraqi National Intelligence Service
Basnews; Al Sumaria TV; Shafaaq News; National Iraqi News Agency

On 2 February 2021, an IS militant on a motorcycle attacked a polling station wounding a police officer guarding a polling station in March 11 school in the Iskan neighborhood of Kirkuk city. Kirkuk police and National Security Agency gave chase and killed the IS militant in a subsequent firefight following a siege in the Azadi neighborhood. 2 police injuries and one IS fatality.

On 1 February 2021, activists organized a demonstration in Chkhorotsku after an aledged news, that schoolchildren forced to clean the city hall toilets. The demonstrators attempted to enter the city hall building, but the police stopped them. [size=no report]
On 1 February 2021, a school teacher was shot and killed by security forces in Ayana (East Welegga, Oromia) after being accused of having links to OLF/Shane.
